p: Concentration of reduced glutathione (GSH) in the liver, kidney and serum was measured by the method of Beutler and Kelly (1963). Two hundred microliter of homogenates, 1.8 mL distilled water and 3 mL of precipitant were thoroughly mixed, incubated for 5 min at 25 °C and filtered. One milliliter of five fold dilution of the filtrate then mixed with 0.5 ml of Ellman's reagent. The blank consists of all other assay components except the homogenates. Absorbance of the resulting solution was read at 412 nm against the blank.
